greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let n in binary be a k-digit number say abbaaa... where a = 1 and b = 0. a(n) = 2^a*3^b*5^b*7*a... primes in increasing order raised to the powers starting from the MSB.
comment: All terms have 2-adic valuation equal to 1, i.e., they equal twice an odd (and squarefree) number, since the first digit in base two will always be "1". - _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 25 2011
2 appears at index n = 2^k for k >= 0, since such n_2 begins with "1" followed by k zeros, and 2^1 * 3^0 * ... * p_(k+1)^0 = 2. - _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 28 2021
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Array[Times @@ Prime@ Flatten@ Position[#, 1] &@ IntegerDigits[#, 2] &, 61] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 28 2021 *)
program: a110765 = product . zipWith (^) a000040_list .  reverse . a030308_row
....return reduce(mul, (prime(i) for i,d in enumerate(bin(n)[2:],start=1) if int(d)))
....return _A110765(n[:-1])*(prime(nlen) if int(n[-1]) else 1) if nlen > 1 else int(n) + 1
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 12 2005
ext: More terms from Stacy Hawthorne (shawtho1(AT)ashland.edu), Oct 31 2005
